column1: Q1. How often, if at all, do you watch men's English Premier  League football matches, either on television or live at a stadium?
Q2. How well or badly would you say VAR has worked in the Premier League?
Q3. Thinking about the use of VAR in the English Premier League so far in the 2019-2020 season...If you were to give VAR a mark from 0 to 10 on how well or badly it's worked
so far, with 0 being a complete failure and 10 being that it has worked perfectly, what mark would you give?
Q4. Overall, how much more or less enjoyable has VAR made watching Premier League football matches, or has it made no difference?
Q5. What would be your preference on the future use of VAR in Premier League football matches?
Keep using VAR as it is used now, without any changes
Keep using VAR, but change the ways in which it is used
Q6. A time limit on how long it can take for decisions to be made using VAR?
No VAR decisions if play continues
Q7. Being able to see the video footage that the video assistant referees are being shown to make their decision?
Q8. In general, do you think VAR has improved or worsened the quality of football played?
Q10. In general, do you think VAR has improved or worsened Pace of the game?

column6: NB: All values are in percentage.
